title: Lawsuit accuses Zion of rape, years of abuse
content: A woman has accused Pelicans forward Zion Williamson of rape in addition to "sexual, physical, emotional and financial" abuse during a relationship that lasted from 2018 to 2023, according to a lawsuit submitted to Los Angeles Superior Court.

title: Sources: 49ers finalizing deal for Eagles DE Huff
content: The San Francisco 49ers and Philadelphia Eagles are working to finalize a trade that will send edge rusher Bryce Huff to San Francisco for a midround pick, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: McCullers gets security in wake of online threats
content: After receiving online death threats over his performance, Lance McCullers Jr., who has two young daughters, worked with the Astros to hire 24-hour security for his family.

title: Big 12 chief: Big Ten, SEC must serve all football
content: The Big Ten and the SEC have the bulk of control over the future of the College Football Playoff, and Big 12 commissioner Brett Yormark says that comes with a "great responsibility" to serve college football over their own wants.

title: World Boxing to require mandatory sex testing
content: Boxers like Olympic champ Imane Khelif will now have to undergo mandatory genetic sex testing in order to compete, World Boxing announced on Friday.

title: Shiffrin: 'Like myself again' after crash PTSD
content: Two-time Olympic champion Mikaela Shiffrin finally feels "like myself again" after recovering from a ski racing crash last season.

title: 49ers, Cavenagh seal Glasgow Rangers takeover
content: A U.S. consortium, led by the owners of the San Francisco 49ers, has completed its takeover of Scottish football giants Rangers.

title: Source: Liverpool bids club-record $147M for Wirtz
content: Liverpool have submitted a club-record ‚Ç¨130 million bid to sign Bayer Leverkusen playmaker Florian Wirtz this summer, a source has told ESPN.

title: üêù Texas teen spells 'eclaircissement' to win title
content: Faizan Zaki went from runner-up last year to champion at the Scripps National Spelling Bee by outlasting eight other spellers to win the title on Thursday night.

title: Forget the elite batting average and eye-popping home runs -- for Aaron Judge, it's all about staying healthy
content: Frequent IL trips early in his career "pissed him off." Now, he's playing every day -- and making history.

title: Something about this OKC team looks familiar ‚Äî and the NBA should be terrified
content: The Thunder have followed in the footsteps of the 2014-15 Golden State Warriors this season. Is a future dynasty in the making?

title: 79.4 mph! How Tennessee pitcher Karlyn Pickens became the hardest thrower softball has ever seen
content: How Tennessee's Karlyn Pickens became a complete pitcher and the hardest thrower in softball history.

title: 19 NFL stars who could get massive contracts this summer: Everything we know about negotiations
content: Our experts have the latest buzz on 19 players and their potential new deals, including multiple Chiefs, Jets and Broncos stars.

title: Updated NBA draft rankings: How the NCAA withdrawal deadline shook up the top 100
content: With 18 of our top 100 NBA prospects returning to college, there's movement in our list, starting at No. 5.

title: NBA draft withdrawal deadline: NIL's impact, Florida's gain, the 2026 draft, more
content: Who are biggest winners and losers from prospects' decisions to stay or go? We answer the burning questions.

title: Which WNBA offseason moves are making the biggest impact -- and who still has work to do?
content: Kelsey Plum, Natasha Cloud and a Phoenix duo have made an immediate impact on their new WNBA teams in 2025.

title: Why the Maple Leafs shouldn't re-sign Mitch Marner -- and what they should do instead
content: Toronto has some franchise-altering decisions to make this summer, starting with the perennial All-Star.

title: Stanley Cup Final odds: McDavid is Conn Smythe fave in Panthers rematch
content: Top ways to bet the series and props for the Stanley Cup Final between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers.

title: No Morgan, no Rapinoe: The USWNT doesn't have a face of the team now. Is that OK?
content: Since Alex Morgan retired, the USWNT has lacked a star leader. Is Trinity Rodman due for that role? Naomi Girma or someone else?

title: Six tied for first-round lead at U.S. Women's Open
content: Angel Yin started experimenting with a new putter about a month ago and decided to use it in a tournament for the first time at the most prestigious event in women's golf.

title: Conference USA preview: Liberty is early favorite but contenders abound
content: The Flames are the team to beat, but Western Kentucky and Jacksonville State (among others) can't be counted out.

title: Meet 12 of the top men's college basketball recruits for 2027, 2028
content: Here's what we saw from some of the top boys' high school basketball players at a USA Basketball training camp.

title: PSG vs. Inter Milan: Ultimate UEFA Champions League final preview, predictions
content: Saturday's showpiece final between PSG and Inter Milan has storylines galore, from the battle of MVP goalkeepers to PSG's treble quest and so much more. Here's everything you need to know.

title: Ancelotti: My Brazil will play like Real Madrid
content: Carlo Ancelotti wants Brazil to play like his Real Madrid team did in the 2023-24 season when they won LaLiga and the Champions League.

title: Alexander-Arnold joins Real Madrid, set for CWC
content: Real Madrid have signed Trent Alexander-Arnold, with a source telling ESPN the clubs agreed to a ‚Ç¨10m deal for his early release for the Club World Cup.

title: Sources: Al Hilal eye Fernandes deal before CWC
content: Al Hilal are exploring the possibility of bringing in Manchester United's Bruno Fernandes ahead of the Club World Cup, sources have told ESPN.

title: Hayes: Starlet Yohannes has big USWNT future
content: USWNT head coach Emma Hayes sung the praises of 17-year-old midfielder Lily Yohannes again on Friday, saying Yohannes has a bright future with the program.

title: Amorim: Utd don't need Fernandes exit for funds
content: Ruben Amorim has said Manchester United can raise funds in other ways than sending Bruno Fernandes to the Saudi Pro League.

title: Liverpool confirm Frimpong deal after TAA exit
content: Liverpool have signed Jeremie Frimpong from Bayer Leverkusen, the Premier League champions confirmed on Friday.

title: PLL Week 1 preview: Everything you need to know for opening weekend
content: It's homecoming weekend for the Atlas. Check here for the full schedule, key stats, injury notes and more.

title: Delayed flights, missed meals and little sleep: How college teams adjusted to cross-country travel
content: How Oregon State baseball and multiple teams at UCLA adapted to new schedules, for better and for worse.

title: IPL 2025 Playoffs: Rohit Sharma punishes GT's butter-fingers in Eliminator
content: In a thrilling Eliminator, Mumbai Indians (MI) defeated Gujarat Titans (GT) by 20 runs. Rohit Sharma capitalised on two dropped catches to score 81, supported by a fiery Jonny Bairstow. MI posted 228. Despite Sai Sudharsan's masterful 80 and a brisk partnership with Washington Sundar, GT fell short. MI now faces Punjab Kings in Qualifier 2.

title: Rolls-Royce, Safran, and Japan join race to build India's next-gen fighter jets
content: India is actively pursuing co-development of fighter jet engines with the UK, France, and Japan to bolster its indigenous aerospace capabilities and reduce reliance on single-source suppliers. This strategic diversification aims to enhance supply chain security and technological self-sufficiency amid growing security challenges.

title: How Rohit Sharma's 'luck' powered Mumbai Indians into IPL Qualifier 2
content: Mumbai Indians defeated Gujarat Titans by 20 runs in a thrilling IPL 2025 Eliminator. Rohit Sharma's brilliant 81 and Jonny Bairstow's impactful debut propelled MI to 228. Despite Sai Sudharsan's valiant 80, Gujarat fell short. Bumrah's crucial yorker and Gleeson's decisive strikes sealed the win for Mumbai, who will now face Punjab Kings in Qualifier 2.

title: BSF smashed Pak posts & systems, will take years to rebuild: Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah praised the BSF in Jammu for dismantling 118 Pakistani posts and surveillance networks after Operation Sindoor. He assured full security for the Amarnath Yatra and vowed retaliation for terror attacks, referencing the May 7 strikes following the Pahalgam killings.

title: Satya Nadella to employees in Town Hall: 6000 job cuts were related to‚Ä¶
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella attributed recent layoffs to reorganization rather than performance, impacting even product development roles. The company is aggressively pushing its Copilot AI assistants, securing a significant deal with Barclays for 100,000 licenses. While adoption is growing, some clients are proceeding cautiously, awaiting clearer returns on Microsoft's AI investments.

title: Assam picking up B'deshi illegals, dumping them in no-man's land
content: Assam's government is intensifying efforts to deport individuals declared illegal foreigners by tribunals, leading to legal challenges. Recent pushbacks into the India-Bangladesh border have prompted petitions to the Supreme Court and Gauhati HC, seeking the whereabouts of family members.

title: 'Definitely not easy ‚Ä¶ ': Heartbroken Shubman Gill
content: Rohit Sharma's explosive 81 propelled Mumbai Indians to a 20-run victory over Gujarat Titans in the Eliminator, ending GT's IPL 2025 campaign. Mumbai posted a formidable 228/5, fueled by Sharma and Bairstow's quickfire 47. Despite Sai Sudharsan's valiant 80, Gujarat fell short, managing only 208/6. Mumbai will now face Punjab Kings in Qualifier 2.

title: How 100 witnesses and evidence exposed VIP cover-up in Rishikesh resort murder case
content: In a verdict delivered in Kotdwar, Pulkit Arya, owner of Vanantra Resort, along with Saurabh Bhaskar and Ankit Gupta, received life imprisonment for the murder of a 19-year-old receptionist. The case, involving charges of murder, destruction of evidence, and sexual harassment, sparked public outrage in Uttarakhand. The victim was killed for refusing to provide "special services" to a VIP guest.

title: Microsoft exec has a message for coders, after it laid off over 2k software engineers
content: Despite recent layoffs impacting software engineers, Microsoft's CPO, Aparna Chennapragada, defends the importance of computer science education. She argues AI is simply another layer of abstraction, transforming roles into "software operators" rather than eliminating them. As Microsoft invests heavily in AI, project managers will also adapt, focusing on editing and refining AI-generated ideas.

title: Why is Trump angry with China again?
content: Donald Trump has accused China of violating their recent trade agreement, claiming he had previously rescued their economy from a 'devastating' situation. Despite a temporary tariff reduction deal reached in Geneva, Trump alleges China hasn't honored its commitments.

title: Assam cops may interrogate Gaurav Gogoi over 'Pak links'
content: Congress leader Gaurav Gogoi may face police interrogation over alleged Pakistan links, as stated by police sources. This follows the questioning of Ripun Bora, ex-Rajya Sabha MP, regarding his defense of Gogoi against these allegations.

title: NFL rumour: Raiders linked to Packers‚Äô Jaire Alexander in bold trade plan
content: Jaire Alexander's future with the Green Bay Packers is uncertain due to injuries and his large contract. The team has reportedly asked him to restructure his deal, and trade rumors are circulating. The Las Vegas Raiders, who need a strong cornerback, may be interested if the price is right, especially after recent roster changes.

title: Elon Musk carries daily medication box with about 20 pills, including ones with ...
content: Reports indicate Elon Musk's drug consumption exceeds occasional use. He allegedly uses stimulants like Adderall, Ecstasy, and psychedelic mushrooms. Sources claim Musk frequently uses ketamine, sometimes daily, mixing it with other drugs. Musk admits to prescribed ketamine for depression, taking it occasionally. He acknowledges ketamine's effect on his bladder. The FDA warns about ketamine's risks, including addiction and bladder problems.

title: 'RCB have won the IPL': Ex-star's bold prediction
content: Phil Salt's explosive fifty propelled Royal Challengers Bengaluru to a dominant eight-wicket victory over Punjab Kings in Qualifier 1, securing their spot in the IPL 2025 final. RCB's bowlers dismantled PBKS for a mere 101 runs, setting the stage for Salt's blistering innings. With this emphatic win, RCB advances to their fourth IPL final, scheduled for June 3.

title: FIR against J&K AAP MLA for threatening woman doctor
content: Mehraj Malik, the only AAP MLA in Jammu and Kashmir, faces legal trouble after being booked for allegedly defaming and criminally intimidating a female doctor in Doda. The FIR was filed following a complaint by Dr.

title: Bayraktar busted: How Indian radars caught Pakistan‚Äôs drone gamble with Turkish tech
content: Turkey's Bayraktar TB2 drones, once celebrated for their effectiveness, have suffered a significant setback in Pakistan's Operation Sindoor. India's Akashteer air defense systems successfully intercepted all Turkish-origin drones, raising doubts about their battlefield credibility. This failure has impacted Turkey's defense ambitions and opened doors for competitors in the global drone market, potentially influencing future arms deals.

title: Bruno Fernandes transfer talk grows as Man Utd face financial pressure
content: Manchester United's financial woes, stemming from missing European competitions, have fueled speculation about Bruno Fernandes' potential move to Al Hilal. The Saudi club's lucrative offer of ¬£80-¬£100 million and a weekly wage of ¬£700,000 is tempting. However, manager R√∫ben Amorim believes Fernandes is committed to staying and proving his worth at Manchester United, despite the club's need to raise funds.

title: In viral video, doctor says 'kill' Covid patient to vacate bed; probe launched
content: Maharashtra police are investigating Dr. Shashikant Deshpande for allegedly instructing a colleague to "kill" a Covid patient in 2021, based on a surfaced audio clip. The conversation reveals Deshpande telling Dr. Dange to "kill that Dayami woman," prompting an FIR against him for inciting religious feelings and caste-based slurs.

title: US, QUAD nations trying to force India into military alliance, not just trade: Russia
content: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov claimed India joined the QUAD for trade, but other members push for military exercises. He warned of a militarization agenda, urging India to see the "provocation." Lavrov also advocated reviving the Russia-India-China (RIC) trilateral mechanism, citing improved India-China border relations, and criticized Western attempts to divide India and China.

title: 'Out ho jata hun': Shubman Gill's flop show sparks meme fest
content: Mumbai Indians set a formidable 228/5, propelled by Rohit Sharma's 81 and Jonny Bairstow's impactful debut of 47. Trent Boult's early dismissal of Shubman Gill dealt a blow to Gujarat Titans' chase in the crucial knockout clash. Hardik Pandya roared in celebration, as did Boult and the rest of the MI camp. Gill reviewed the decision, but the replays didn‚Äôt favor him, and he walked back disappointed.

title: BJP: 'After Tharoor, will Cong turn on Khurshid for Article 370 remark?'
content: The BJP has questioned whether Congress will target Salman Khurshid after Shashi Tharoor faced criticism for supporting the Centre's stance on Operation Sindoor. Amit Malviya highlighted Khurshid's remarks on normalcy in Jammu & Kashmir post Article 370 abrogation, suggesting bipartisan support.

title: 'No politician should ... ': BJP chides Mamata for personal remarks against PM Modi
content: The BJP strongly criticized West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee for her personal attacks on PM Modi, particularly regarding the naming of 'Operation Sindoor.' Banerjee accused Modi of exploiting the operation for political gain and questioned his remarks about women. The BJP refuted claims of a sindoor distribution campaign and accused the opposition of undermining India's military action.

title: Indian-American student torches alma mater, Israel at MIT graduation ceremony
content: During MIT's graduation, Indian-American student Megha Vemuri criticized the university's ties with the Israeli military, specifically Elbit Systems, and voiced support for Palestine. She accused Israel of attempting to erase Palestine and urged MIT to sever its connections.

title: Sarfaraz Khan silences critics again with gritty 92 vs England Lions
content: Sarfaraz Khan impresses with a solid 92 for India A after facing Test squad setbacks. His innings against England Lions showcases his red-ball skills. Earlier, he debuted well against England but later faced exclusion. Selectors opted for other players, citing experience. Ajit Agarkar explained the squad selection, emphasizing limited spots. India's Test series in England starts June 20.

title: Dwyane Wade‚Äôs daughter fights a rare vision condition as she begins a new chapter
content: Zaya Wade celebrated her 18th birthday, marking a significant milestone as she prepares for college. Despite a visual impairment that makes reading difficult, Zaya remains focused on her academic goals and future aspirations. Supported by her parents, Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union, she plans to study fashion and social justice, aiming to use her voice to help others.

title: Hardik Pandya includes 150kph rocket vs Gujarat Titans
content: In a crucial IPL 2025 Eliminator clash, Mumbai Indians opted to bat first after Hardik Pandya won the toss against Gujarat Titans in Mullanpur. Mumbai Indians made three changes, bringing in Jonny Bairstow, Richard Gleeson, and Raj Angad Bawa. The winner of this match will go on to face Punjab Kings in the Qualifier 2 Ahmedabad.

title: Will Bryce Harper play tonight against Brewers? Latest injury report
content: Phillies fans are eagerly awaiting the decision on Bryce Harper's availability for tonight's game against the Brewers after he suffered an elbow injury. While X-rays revealed no fractures, swelling persisted, keeping him out of recent games. A final determination will be made just before the 6:45 p.m. ET start, with the team prioritizing his long-term health.

title: DGCA grants final 3-month extension to IndiGo for 2 Turkish Boeing B777s
content: India's DGCA granted IndiGo a final three-month extension, until August 31, for its wet-leased Boeing 777s from Turkish Airlines, averting immediate flight disruptions. This decision follows IndiGo's request for a six-month extension, which was denied. The backdrop includes strained relations with Turkey, evidenced by revoked security clearances for a Turkish ground handling company.

title: Jihadi content, madrasa attack & murders: Inside Bengal engineer‚Äôs 'terror trail'
content: Humayun Kabir, a Jadavpur University graduate, was arrested for murdering his parents in Memari. He also attacked four teachers at a Bongaon orphanage. Kabir was found to be radicalized and browsing jihadi literature. He had lost his job and was divorced. Police are investigating his extremist links and a possible plan to flee to Bangladesh.

title: Inside story of Elon Musk's drug use
content: Musk‚Äôs drug use didn‚Äôt begin on the campaign trail‚Äîit simply became more public, more intense, and, crucially, more consequential. The Wall Street Journal had already reported in 2023 that some Tesla board members were concerned about his substance use, including Ambien, the sleep aid that Musk once claimed helped him stop "overthinking." But according to The Times, what followed in 2024‚Äì25 was a full-spectrum spiral.

title: Bold gamble! Why MI handed three surprise debuts vs GT
content: Mumbai Indians elected to bat after winning the toss against Gujarat Titans in the IPL 2025 Eliminator. Hardik Pandya cited a batting-friendly pitch as the reason behind the decision. MI made three changes, bringing in Bairstow, Gleeson, and Bawa, while GT included Mendis and Sundar in place of Buttler and Arshad Khan.

title: After Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma achieves this stunning IPL feat
content: Rohit Sharma achieved a significant milestone in his IPL career, becoming the second player to surpass 7000 runs. During the Eliminator against Gujarat Titans, he scored a fluent 81 off 50 balls, featuring nine fours and four sixes. Despite being dropped twice, Rohit capitalized on the opportunities, helping Mumbai Indians post a formidable powerplay score.

title: 'Incapable of waging war': Shah lauds BSF for destroying Pak's communication system
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah lauded the Border Security Force (BSF) for their decisive response to Pakistan's aggression following Operation Sindoor. Shah stated that the BSF destroyed 118 Pakistani posts in three days, dismantling their surveillance network. He emphasized the significant blow to Pakistan's communication and surveillance capabilities, asserting it would take years to recover.

title: Which US university has the highest percentage of international students?
content: Harvard University is battling the Trump administration‚Äôs attempt to block it from enrolling international students, citing violations of legal procedures. A federal judge has temporarily halted the order, highlighting broader tensions between the administration and higher education. International students contribute $43.8 billion annually to the US economy, yet hostile policies are driving them toward countries like Canada and Japan. Data shows that top US universities have international enrollments exceeding 40%, raising concerns over future academic and financial stability.

title: BPSC 2025: Notification for DSO/AD posts released; applications open from June 3
content: Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) has announced recruitment for 47 District Statistical Officer (DSO) and Assistant Director (AD) posts under Advt. No. 38/2025. Online applications will be accepted from June 3 to June 24, 2025. Candidates must hold a master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, or Economics. The preliminary exam is scheduled for August 3, 2025. Detailed vacancy and reservation information, eligibility criteria, and application instructions are available on the official BPSC website.

title: Revised Canadian policy eases job transitions for foreign workers
content: Canada has introduced a policy effective May 27, allowing temporary foreign workers to change jobs faster while awaiting work permit processing. This benefits workers, including many from India, by reducing downtime and enabling better opportunities. Immigration consultant Kubeir Kamal highlights the positive impact on Indian workers in sectors like IT and healthcare.

title: India‚Äôs Q4 GDP growth beats estimates at 7.4% - Top points
content: India's economy exceeded expectations with a 7.4% growth in the fourth quarter of FY 2024-25. However, the full fiscal year GDP growth is provisionally estimated at 6.5%, marking a four-year low compared to previous years.

title: K Kavitha or KTR? BRS caught in ‚Äòsuccession‚Äô crossfire
content: As the Bharat Rashtra Samithi celebrates its silver jubilee, a power struggle seems to be emerging between KCR's children, KTR and Kavitha, fueled by dissatisfaction over party control and influence. Kavitha's discontent surfaced after expressing concerns about KCR's speech and her perceived sidelining within the party, leading her to independently pursue initiatives.

title: WWE SmackDown preview: Full match card, confirmed segments, how to watch and more
content: SmackDown on May 30, 2025, from Knoxville, Tennessee, will feature John Cena and Cody Rhodes under one roof before their Money in the Bank tag team match. Andrade, Jacob Fatu, and Carmelo Hayes will battle in a Men's MITB Qualifying match, while Jade Cargill, Nia Jax, and Naomi compete for the women's spot. Bianca Belair will also make her homecoming.

title: 'More famous now': Pahalgam terror attack plotter at Lahore rally
content: Lashkar-e-Taiba commander Saifullah Kasuri, a key plotter in the Pahalgam terror attack, delivered an inflammatory anti-India speech in Lahore, surrounded by Pakistani security forces and ISI officials. He boasted about his notoriety following the attack, sharing the stage with US-designated terrorist Talha Saeed. "I have become more famous since being accused of the attack," he gloated, as per information reaching here.

title: UN declares Gaza the only region where 100% of population faces famine risk
content: The United Nations reports a dire situation in Gaza. Every person there faces famine. Chaos and desperation grip the region. Israeli strikes killed police officers trying to control looting. Aid distribution faces immense challenges. People struggle to get food. Ceasefire talks are ongoing. A new proposal was presented but rejected. The conflict continues to cause immense suffering.

title: 'No country backed India': Cong says BJP‚Äôs 'foreign policy failed' post-Op Sindoor
content: The Congress party has strongly criticized the BJP government's foreign policy following Operation Sindoor, citing diplomatic failures and compromised national security. Allegations include a lack of international support, growing ties between Pakistan and other nations, and questions surrounding the neutralization of key terrorists. Shashi Tharoor voiced disappointment over condolences for those killed in Pakistan.

title: "Will Remain Friend, Adviser To Trump": Elon Musk After Quitting As DOGE Chief
content: Elon Musk, who stepped down as the chief of DOGE, meant to save "trillions" in American taxpayer dollars, identify fraudulent government schemes, and cut bureaucracy, has said that he will continue to remain a friend and adviser to the President.

title: "We Talked, They Stopped": Trump Repeats India-Pak Ceasefire Claim
content: US President Donald Trump on Friday repeated his claim that he stopped India and Pakistan from fighting and told the two nations that his administration cannot trade with people that are shooting at each other.

title: Ex-MLA Gets 6 Months In Jail For Threatening To Blow Up Parliament
content: A Delhi court on Friday sentenced former Madhya Pradesh MLA Kishore Samrite to six months in jail for threatening to blow up Parliament in September 2022 over his 'unfulfilled demands'.

title: 'To Kill A Tyrant': Zelensky's Pick At Book Fair Raises Eyebrows
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy and his wife browsed the stalls at a literary fair in Kyiv on Friday and left with some new reading material - a book entitled "To Kill A Tyrant."

title: "We Are Not Greedy For Pakistan, Their Region": Salman Khurshid On Op Sindoor
content: India is not greedy for Pakistan and does not seek to capture their territory or destroy them, Congress leader Salman Khurshid has said.

title: Indian-Origin CEO Joins Harvard Board As Canadian PM Mark Carney Steps Down
content: In addition to Sud's appointment, Sanjay Seth, a climate and sustainability expert, has been elected as one of the new directors of the Harvard Alumni Association (HAA).

title: "Jan-Jan Sakshar": Goa Declared Fully Literate State On Statehood Day
content: In a landmark achievement, Goa declared itself a fully literate State on Friday, becoming a beacon of inspiration for the rest of the country, officials said.

title: Explained: Trump's Multi-Pronged Attack On Harvard University
content: The administration of US President Donald Trump is waging a campaign against Harvard University, the country's oldest and richest school, across multiple fronts, including funding freezes, investigations and threats to the school's tax-exempt status.

title: US Supreme Court Allows Trump To Revoke "Parole" Status Of Migrants
content: The US Supreme Court on Friday let President Donald Trump's administration revoke the temporary legal status of hundreds of thousands of Venezuelan, Cuban, Haitian and Nicaraguan migrants living in the United States.

title: After PM's 'Haunk Diya' Remark, Here's Your Guide To All Things 'Kanpuriya'
content: When your 'bhaukaal' is at its peak, people are aware that they might be at the receiving end of a 'kantaap' if they indulge in too much 'bakloli'.

title: Pakistan Upgrades Ties With Afghanistan Days After China's Taliban Outreach
content: Days after a China-convened meeting that pushed for greater Pakistan-Afghanistan ties, Islamabad has made a significant announcement - that it will be sending an Ambassador to Kabul soon.

title: PM Modi Accepts Operation Sindoor Portrait From Class 7 Girl In Kanpur
content: An 11-year-old girl presented a portrait depicting Operation Sindoor to Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his public meeting held here on Friday to inaugurate developmental projects worth Rs 47,600 crore.

title: Hamas Struck Wrong Army Base In October 7 Attack After Navigation Error: Report
content: Hamas terrorists who infiltrated southern Israel during the October 7, 2023 massacre intended to capture a sensitive military intelligence base but made a critical navigation error, a report said.

title: Etienne-Emile Baulieu, Scientist Who Invented Abortion Pill, Dies At 98
content: French scientist Etienne-Emile Baulieu, known as the inventor of the abortion pill, died at the age of 98 at his home in Paris on Friday, his wife told AFP.

title: Bomb Threats At Delhi's Udyog Bhawan, Nirman Bhawan Turn Out To Be Hoax
content: Threats via e-mails to blow up two government buildings in central Delhi -- Udyog Bhawan and Nirman Bhawan -- prompted security agencies to carry out an extensive sanitisation exercise. The threat later turned out to be a hoax.

title: "He'll Always Be With Us": Trump Gives Farewell To Musk After DOGE Exit
content: US President Donald Trump hosts a grand Oval Office farewell for Elon Musk on Friday as the world's richest man ends his turbulent reign as the government's cost-cutter-in-chief.

title: Karnataka Records Highest May Rainfall In 125 Years: Siddaramaiah
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Friday said, for the first time in the last 125 years, the state has recorded the highest rainfall in the month of May, and 28 districts have received more than usual rainfall.

title: IndiGo Told To Stop Lease Of Turkish Aircraft After Ankara's Support For Pak
content: Sending a big signal after Turkey supported Pakistan during Operation Sindoor, the Centre has asked IndiGo to end its aircraft lease agreement with Turkish Airlines within three months.

title: India's Response Non-Escalatory After Pahalgam Terror Attack: Raghav Chadha
content: Calling Operation Sindoor a "measured" and "non-escalatory" response to the Pahalgam terror attack, Raghav Chadha said India's hand of friendship can transform into a "fist of retribution" if someone indulges in misadventure.

title: PM Modi Meets Family Of Pahalgam Attack Victim Shubham Dwivedi In Kanpur
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday met the family of Shubham Dwivedi, who was among the 26 people killed in the April 22 terror attack in Pahalgam.

title: Transfer window preview: What do Europe's big clubs need?
content: The first transfer window is set to open across Europe on June 1, so what are the top clubs planning? Who comes in? Who will go?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool duo wanted by Saudi clubs
content: Saudi Pro League clubs are showing interest in Darwin Nunez and Luis Diaz. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Ohtani scores 170 runs? Royals have a top-10 starting pitcher? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: How many fights is Erin Blanchfield away from a title shot?
content: Erin Blanchfield, Tatsuro Taira and Song Yadong have all headlined ESPN's top 25 MMA fighters under 25 list, but none has fought for a UFC title. Whose path is closest to the belt?

title: Can Jermall Charlo, Caleb Plant gain steam on collision course?
content: Charlo and Plant fight on separate bouts on Saturday. Andreas Hale lists five things to know ahead of the fight.

title: Denial of Rajya Sabha seat to Vaiko won‚Äôt affect alliance, says Durai Vaiko
content: Recalling that Vaiko has declined Cabinet berths at the Centre thrice, he reiterates that the MDMK leader has never been after posts or positions, so the alliance will continue in the interest of the State

title: Dental clinic‚Äôs unsterile practices led to death of 8 in Vaniyambadi: study
content: Tirupattur Collector to order closure of the clinic¬†after study reveals that use of unsterile surgical instrument allegedly led to death of eight patients after they contracted neuro melioidosis in 2023

title: I have got my freedom and party can move forward: Anbumani Ramadoss
content: He reiterates that all appointments made within the party, including president, general secretary, and treasurer, could only be made by the party‚Äôs general council

title: Home Secretary likely to visit Manipur next week
content: Govind Mohan is set to review security and relief work as Meitei civil society group calls for ‚Äúcivil disobedience‚Äù ahead of the visit, journalists boycotted government events, and protestors demanded apology for the May 20 incident.

title: Bank frauds growing under Modi rule: Congress chief Kharge
content: Congress president criticises PM Modi for rising bank frauds, accusing his government of ‚Äúfraud and fakery‚Äù

title: HC sets aside Alwal Tahsildar‚Äôs order declaring Tholla Karkhana land as government property
content: The HC instructed the revenue officials to issue appropriate notices to the affected parties before removing them from the land to declare the property as government land

title: Karnataka on its way to emerge as leading MRO hub in Asia: M.B. Patil

title: IndiGo CEO pitches for India as global hub for connecting flights

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Notre Dame pushes closer to the top spot

title: MLB Power Rankings: Does a team from the AL or NL belong at No. 1?

title: Betting WNBA Futures: Where Clark, Bueckers fit in MVP, ROY race
